pullRequest.body:
Many of these can just be inlined.

I've left the ones around `to_additive` alone, as often these are a stylistic choice.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Thanks! Once CI is happy, please merge this PR using `bors r+`
bors d+

:v: eric-wieser can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

### PR summary

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9427999050/job/25972814722)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9427999050/job/25972814556)
Answer: you can't, this never made sense in the first place.
These are obviously pretty useless docstrings, but I just moved them from a few lines below!

You can use a common docstring for all coefficients. Something like (optional)
```lean
  /-- Coefficients of a Weierstrass curve (write eqn). -/
  (a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ a‚ÇÉ a‚ÇÑ a‚ÇÜ : R)
```
This will result in the same docstring being repeated 6 times in the docs, which seems worse than these docstrings. I'll push an alternate change in a new PR.

Actually, no I won't. I was thinking of
```
structure WeierstrassCurve (R : Type u) where
  /-- The coefficient of $XY$. -/
  a‚ÇÅ : R
  /-- The coefficient of $X^2$. -/
  a‚ÇÇ : R
  /-- The coefficient of $Y$. -/
  a‚ÇÉ : R
  /-- The coefficient of $X$. -/
  a‚ÇÑ : R
  /-- The constant coefficient. -/
  a‚ÇÜ : R
```
but then this is inconsistent with the `b` and `c` coefficients.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - doc: clean up some `add_decl_doc`s
